feed.title: Google Cloud: Google Cloud VMware Engine
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Google Cloud VMware Engine

entry.content:
This is to notify you about upcoming changes in licensing model with Google Cloud VMware Engine following Broadcom's recent announcement to move to a "bring your own" subscription model for VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF).

You can renew or add additional capacity of VMware Engine nodes with VCF-license included until October 15, 2025. After that, Google Cloud will not be able to sell new VMware Engine VCF license-included nodes. You can buy new VMware Engine BYOL nodes and use them with "bring your own" VCF subscriptions (purchased by you from Broadcom) for new capacity after October 15, 2025.

For any questions, please reach out to your Google Cloud sales team, who can help review your specific scenarios, discuss the implications of these changes for your organization, and help you manage this transition.

For more details, see the October 3, 2025 service announcement.
entry.summary: VMware Engine is updating its licensing model in line with Broadcom's announcement. You can purchase VCF license-included nodes until October 15, 2025. After this date, new capacity will require a Bring Your Own License (BYOL) subscription for VCF purchased directly from Broadcom. Please contact your Google Cloud sales team for assistance with this transition.
entry.title: Announcement: VMware Engine Licensing Changes

entry.content:
VMware Engine ve2 nodes are now available in the following additional region:

  • Doha, Qatar (me-central1, v-zone-a)
entry.summary: VMware Engine `ve2` nodes are now available in Doha, Qatar. This expansion offers new options for customers in the region.
entry.title: Announcement: VMware Engine nodes now in Doha

entry.content:
All 3-year Committed Use Discounts (CUDs) for VMware Engine ve1 SKUs are now End-of-Sale across all regions where the service is available.

The following specific 3-year commitments are impacted by this change:

  • 3-year commitment (monthly payments), Fully Licensed Pricing - "postpaid"
  • 3-year commitment (upfront payments), Fully Licensed Pricing - "prepay"
  • 3-year commitment (monthly payments), Fully Licensed convertible commitment - "postpaid"
  • 3-year commitment (upfront payments), Fully Licensed convertible commitment - "prepay"
  • 3-year commitment (monthly payments), Portable License Pricing - "postpaid"
  • 3-year commitment (upfront payments), Portable License Pricing - "prepay"
  • 3-year commitment (monthly payments), Protected License Pricing - "postpaid"
  • 3-year commitment (upfront payments), Protected License Pricing - "prepay"

Refer to VMware Engine node types for the regional availability of ve1 SKUs.
entry.summary: All 3-year Committed Use Discounts for VMware Engine ve1 SKUs are now End-of-Sale. This impacts various commitment types, including monthly and upfront payments with different licensing options. Please refer to the VMware Engine node types documentation for regional availability.
entry.title: Announcement: 3-year VMware Engine CUDs End-of-Sale

entry.content:
VMware Engine ve2 nodes are now available in the following additional region and zone:

  • The Milan, Italy, Europe region (europe-west8-a).
  • The Melbourne, Australia (australia-southeast2-b) zone in the Melbourne, Australia region (australia-southeast2).
entry.summary: VMware Engine `ve2` nodes are now available in the Milan, Italy region (europe-west8-a) and the Melbourne, Australia zone (australia-southeast2-b).
entry.title: Announcement: New VMware Engine nodes in Milan and Melbourne

entry.content: You can now use Privileged Access Manager (PAM) to accelerate the deletion of "soft deleted" private clouds. For more information, see the documentation on how to delete a private cloud.
entry.summary: Privileged Access Manager (PAM) now speeds up the deletion of
entry.title: Feature: Accelerate Private Cloud Deletion

entry.content: VMware Engine ve2 nodes are now available in the London, England, Europe region (europe-west2-a).
entry.summary: VMware Engine `ve2` nodes are now available in the London, England, Europe region (`europe-west2-a`).
entry.title: Announcement: VMware Engine nodes now in London

entry.content: VMware Engine v2 nodes are now available in the Santiago, Chile (southamerica-west1-b) zone in the Santiago region (southamerica-west1) region.
entry.summary: VMware Engine v2 nodes are now available in Santiago, Chile.
entry.title: Announcement: New VMware Engine nodes in Santiago

entry.content: VMware Engine ve2 nodes are now available in the Dammam, KSA (me-central2) region.
entry.summary: VMware Engine `ve2` nodes are available in Dammam, KSA (`me-central2`) region.
entry.title: Announcement: VMware Engine nodes now in Dammam

entry.content: VMware Engine ve2 nodes are now available in the São Paulo, Brazil (southamerica-east1-c) zone in the São Paulo region (southamerica-east1).
entry.summary: VMware Engine `ve2` nodes are now available in the São Paulo zone (`southamerica-east1-c`), in the São Paulo region (`southamerica-east1`). This expansion brings dedicated bare-metal compute capacity closer to customers in South America.
entry.title: Announcement: VMware Engine nodes now in São Paulo

entry.content: When upgrading to Windows Server 2022 or newer images on your GCVE private clouds, you can use a combination of Windows Server BYOL for Windows Server 2019 and earlier images and on-demand licensing for Google-provided Windows Server 2022. For more information, see Use a combination of BYOL and on-demand Windows Server licenses from Google.
entry.summary: You can now use a combination of Windows Server BYOL and on-demand licensing for Google-provided Windows Server 2022 images when upgrading your GCVE private clouds. This provides flexibility for managing your Microsoft licenses.
entry.title: Feature: Windows Server Licensing Options for GCVE

entry.content: VMware Engine single-node private clouds, created after June 4th 2025, will no longer delete after 60 days. All single-node private clouds will have no time limit. Single-node private clouds have limitations to SLA, patching, and upgrades.
entry.summary: Single-node VMware Engine private clouds created after June 4th, 2025, will no longer have a 60-day deletion limit. All single-node private clouds will now have unlimited usage. However, these single-node private clouds have specific limitations regarding SLA, patching, and upgrades.
entry.title: Feature: VMware Engine single-node private clouds have unlimited usage

entry.content: VMware Engine ve2 nodes are now available in Toronto, Canada (northamerica-northeast2).
entry.summary: The `ve2` nodes for VMware Engine are now available in Toronto, Canada.
entry.title: Announcement: VMware Engine nodes now in Toronto

entry.content:
VMware Engine ve2 nodes are now available in the following additional region:

  • Melbourne, Australia (australia-southeast2-a)
entry.summary: VMware Engine `ve2` nodes are now available in Melbourne, Australia.
entry.title: Announcement: VMware Engine nodes now in Melbourne
